bug.author: lluunn
bug.summary: Jupyter service on master not working
bug.description:
When I click "spawn", nothing happens. Saw this in the pod <denchmark-code>HTTP response headers: HTTPHeaderDict({'Audit-Id': '888aaf55-53d0-4086-99ba-b64cb2893c23', 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'X-Content-Type-Options': 'nosniff', 'Date': 'Wed, 19 Jun 2019 22:10:59 GMT', 'Content-Length': '344'}) HTTP response body: {"kind":"Status","apiVersion":"v1","metadata":{},"status":"Failure","message":"podpresets.kubeflow.org is forbidden: User \"system:serviceaccount:kubeflow:jupyter-web-app-service-account\" cannot list podpresets.kubeflow.org in the namespace \"kubeflow\"","reason":"Forbidden","details":{"group":"kubeflow.org","kind":"podpresets"},"code":403} </denchmark-code>
podpreset has been renamed to poddefaults.kubeflow.org

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.96. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
The jupyter webapp image is from May2, needs update.

Next error: the statefulset cannot be created <denchmark-code>Warning FailedCreate 9s (x14 over 30s) statefulset-controller create Pod test1-0 in StatefulSet test1 failed error: pods "test1-0" is forbidden: error looking up service account kubeflow/default-editor: serviceaccount "default-editor" not found </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kunmingg>@kunmingg</denchmark-link> is there supposed to be a default-editor service account, and we missed it in kustomize? Or we changed the name? I can see there is a service account called jupyter-web-app-notebook-service-account

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lluunn>@lluunn</denchmark-link>
You can create a profile and use notebook in profile-namespace. kubeflow namespace is a system namespace for shared components

deleted in: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/158>kubeflow/manifests#158</denchmark-link>
It seems not have a consumer.

So users are not supposed to do stuff in kubeflow namespace? Seems like an unnecessary constraint if the user is admin and doesn't need multi-user feature. cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link>

I think jupyter-web-app-jupyter-notebook-role-binding binds the wrong service account name, no prefix. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/master/jupyter/jupyter-web-app/base/role-binding.yaml#L10>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/master/jupyter/jupyter-web-app/base/role-binding.yaml#L10</denchmark-link>
Should we create a profile by default for the user who deploys Kubeflow?

Is this a duplicate of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3505>#3505</denchmark-link> ? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/abhi-g>@abhi-g</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link> can you confirm if this has been fixed in the latest images?

I am trying to verify but running into a different issue. My master is synced at commit <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commit/dcaeee742984533a2aff34bb28e14ea5aa9ae74a>dcaeee7</denchmark-link> . After deployment the Jupyter Web App is sending an "Internal Server Error" <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11774566/60182578-6c2b8680-97d9-11e9-85e5-b99df74a4b49.png></denchmark-link>
I recall there were some PRs to fix the Manifests. Does kfctl deploy "pinned" manifests or from master?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/abhi-g>@abhi-g</denchmark-link> maybe your browser has the previous version of the webapp cached. If you are using Chrome, could you:
Click Command+Option+I(Mac) or Control+Shift+I(Windows) to open the Dev Tools Go to the Network tab Check the disable cache checkbox Reload the page with the dev tools open
This will force the browser to not use the cached page. I'm not sure regarding kfctl and the manifests, maybe <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> could provide more info here. When I was testing the webapp, I was deploying it by:
cloning the manifests repo From the master branch cd jupyter/jupyter-web-app/base kubectl apply -k .
Lastly if you've deployed from the manifests, is the pod's image tag set to ? Also, is there a with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/master/jupyter/jupyter-web-app/base/config-map.yaml>these</denchmark-link> contents?

In my case, gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/jupyter-web-app:f8d85ad is being used. Let me verify the manifests at master and redeploy. I can certainly 'kubectl apply -k' from the manifests repo, but I want to ensure kfctl is also picking up the correct manifests when deploying... <denchmark-link:#>‚Ä¶</denchmark-link>
On Wed, Jun 26, 2019 at 6:47 AM Kimonas Sotirchos ***@***.***> wrote: @abhi-g <https://github.com/abhi-g> maybe your browser has the previous version of the webapp cached. If you are using Chrome, could you:
1. Click Command+Option+I(Mac) or Control+Shift+I(Windows) to open the Dev Tools <https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/shortcuts> 2. Go to the Network tab 3. Check the disable cache checkbox 4. Reload the page with the dev tools open
This will force the browser to not use the cached page.
I'm not sure regarding kfctl and the manifests, maybe @yanniszark <https://github.com/yanniszark> could provide more info here. When I was testing the webapp, I was deploying it by:
1. cloning the manifests repo 2. From the master branch cd jupyter/jupyter-web-app/base 3. kubectl apply -k .
Lastly if you've deployed from the manifests, is the pod's image tag set to dcaeee7? Also, is there a jupyter-web-app-config with these <https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/master/jupyter/jupyter-web-app/base/config-map.yaml> contents?

Verified <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commit/9bb2c0176506950415cee95c602d66dd88cc3f92>9bb2c01</denchmark-link>
and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/commit/cd5c491e9492844a12294e48f0961382c2cd2669>kubeflow/manifests@cd5c491</denchmark-link>
That the jupyter-web-app: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commit/dcaeee742984533a2aff34bb28e14ea5aa9ae74a>dcaeee7</denchmark-link> works correctly as intended with the multi-user isolation profiles..
notebook service is still not working in kubeflow namespace right?

I was able to get it to deploy from master last week. Will try again tomorrow. <denchmark-link:#>‚Ä¶</denchmark-link>
On Tue, Jul 9, 2019 at 12:04 PM Lun-Kai Hsu ***@***.***> wrote: notebook service is still not working in kubeflow namespace right?
